--- Derek James <blue5432@...> wrote:
> --- zenguyuno <zenguyuno@...> wrote:
> > I'm Mitchell Timin and I just joined your group at
> > Ken Stanley's 
> > suggestion.  Hello to everyone!
> 
> Hi, Mitch.  Welcome. :)  And the same to everybody
> else who's joined recently.
> 
> > My own controller is an ANN, produced by more
> > conventional 
> > neuroevolution.  
> 
> Exactly what approach did you use?  Are you using a
> fixed topology and just evolving the weights?  

Yes.  The seven inputs all connect to 30 hidden layer
neurons, which all connect to 4 output neurons.  The
neurons use the sigmoid, 1/(1+exp(x)).  The weights
were evolved with EvSail-2.1, which will be available
any day now.  (maybe today)  It took about 25 hours of
evolution.

> I had a look at your website, but I haven't
> downloaded
> or looked at the code.  Looks pretty cool, though.

To motivate you to look at the code, I just counted
the lines of C code that perform the ANN computation. 
There are only 14!  (I only counted lines that
execute.)  This code reads the weights from one long
array and computes the outputs, putting them into a
small array.

m

http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
